strategy: Consider employing Curriculum Learning for training the agent. Start by designing simpler versions of the MountainCarContinuous environment where the agent starts with relatively easier initial positions or has a reduced goal distance to cover. Gradually, increase the complexity of the environment by moving to more challenging versions as the agent demonstrates proficiency in simpler tasks. This stepwise approach can help in better gradient estimation and exploration strategies, enabling the agent to learn more robust policies that are transferable to more complex scenarios.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > src/config.yaml
train_config:
  num_train_steps: 20000000
  evaluate_every_epochs: 1000
  num_test_rollouts: 164
  num_train_envs: 256
  max_grad_norm: 0.5
  gamma: 0.99
  n_steps: 256
  n_minibatch: 8
  lr_begin: 6e-04
  lr_end: 5e-04
  lr_warmup: 0.03
  epoch_ppo: 4
  clip_eps: 0.1
  gae_lambda: 0.99
  entropy_coeff: 0.1
  critic_coeff: 0.5
  network_name: "Model"
  network_config:
    num_hidden_units: 256
    num_hidden_layers: 4
  curriculum_learning: True
  initial_position_range: [-0.6, -0.4]
  final_position_range: [-0.6, 0.5]
ENDOFFILE
